p: However, despite the large Li storage capacity of NiCo 2S 4, there are still problems related to the low reversibility of charge/discharge processes due to the accompanying volume variation, leading to material disintegration and consequently severe capacity fading [ 18]. Another serious problem originates from the shuttle effect of polysulfides produced by the dissolution of lithium polysulfide (LPS) in the electrolyte, resulting in a low capacity retention as well [ 19, 20].
